summary:
# Daily AI Newsletter Digest - 1/12/2025

## üî• Top Stories
- Researchers from Wuhan University, China, have introduced a new method for link prediction in social networks, called Common Neighbor Completion with Information Entropy (CNCIE), which leverages logical relationships between neighbors and incorporates information entropy to improve link prediction accuracy.
- The AI Automation Society shared its top 10 posts of the week, featuring updates on n8n nodes, Gemini's File Search API, and self-hosted n8n deals, with Nate Herk's new video on the 17 nodes needed to build anything in n8n being the most popular post.
- The community showcased a customer churn prevention and re-engagement agent built using n8n, demonstrating the potential applications of automation and workflow management in real-world scenarios.

## ü§ñ AI Models & Research
- The CNCIE approach defines logical predicates for neighbor relationships and uses multi-layer perceptrons to encode each logical set, allowing it to systematically model logical contexts and improve link prediction accuracy in incomplete graphs.
- The method incorporates information entropy to quantify uncertainty in predictions, which helps to emphasize nodes where uncertainty is highest and improves prediction confidence, making it a promising technique for feature-engineering in social networks and other applications.

## üõ†Ô∏è Tools & Products
- n8n updates include a new video on the 17 nodes needed to build anything in n8n, an overview of Gemini's new File Search API, and an announcement about n8n Version 2.0, indicating a growing ecosystem and community around the tool.
- Self-hosted n8n deals are available, with a current offer of $3.50 per month, making it more accessible for individuals and organizations to implement automation and workflow management solutions.

## üì∞ Industry News
- The AI Automation Society community is discussing various topics, including Dev Ops and optimization for self-hosted n8n, the use of n8n for automation and workflow management, and the potential applications of automation in different industries.
- Emerging trends in automation and workflow management are evident, with a focus on leveraging AI and machine learning techniques to improve link prediction accuracy and enhance business processes.

## üìö Resources & Learning
- The AI Automation Society newsletter provides links to daily, every 14 days, and monthly digests, as well as options to change notification settings and start your own skool, offering a range of resources for individuals to learn and engage with the community.
- JournalClub.io provides access to the full video or audio discussion of the CNCIE approach, as well as the original research paper, and offers options to manage newsletter preferences and unsubscribe, making it a valuable resource for researchers and practitioners in the field.

Total Newsletters: 2

newsletters.summary:
## AI Automation Society Newsletter

### Key Highlights
- The top 10 posts of the week have been shared, covering various topics such as n8n nodes, Gemini's File Search API, and self-hosted n8n deals.
- Nate Herk has shared multiple updates, including a new video on the 17 nodes needed to build anything in n8n, an overview of Gemini's new File Search API, and an announcement about n8n Version 2.0.
- The community has shared their wins and achievements, including a weekly recap and a showcase of a customer churn prevention and re-engagement agent.

### Detailed Points
- The newsletter highlights the top 10 posts of the week, with the most popular ones being:
  - Nate Herk's new video on the 17 nodes needed to build anything in n8n, with 355 likes and 228 comments.
  - Nate Herk's overview of Gemini's new File Search API, with 252 likes and 134 comments.
  - Nate Herk's announcement about n8n Version 2.0, with 252 likes and 96 comments.
- Other notable posts include:
  - A weekly recap of wins and achievements, with 36 likes and 36 comments.
  - A showcase of a customer churn prevention and re-engagement agent, with 15 likes and 27 comments.
  - A warning about a potential issue with decimal points in workflow agents, with 23 likes and 19 comments.
- The community is also discussing various topics, including:
  - Self-hosted n8n deals, with a current offer of $3.50 per month.
  - Dev Ops and optimization for self-hosted n8n.
  - The use of n8n for automation and workflow management.
- The community has also shared their achievements and milestones, including:
  - A member who has almost finished their grade 10 and is looking for opportunities to learn more about AI and automation.
  - A member who has built a customer churn prevention and re-engagement agent using n8n.

newsletters.subject: Common Neighbor Completion with Information Entropy for Link Prediction in Social Networks
newsletters.summary:
## JournalClub.io Newsletter

### Key Highlights
- Researchers from Wuhan University, China, have introduced a new method for link prediction in social networks, called Common Neighbor Completion with Information Entropy (CNCIE).
- The CNCIE approach leverages logical relationships between neighbors and incorporates information entropy to improve link prediction accuracy, especially in incomplete graphs.
- The method has been tested against benchmarks and has shown promising results, making it potentially useful for feature-engineering in social networks and other applications.

### Detailed Points
- The newsletter discusses the challenge of link prediction in social networks, which involves identifying missing links between entities based on their connections and relationships.
- Traditional methods for link prediction, such as Common Neighbors, Adamic-Adar index, and Resource Allocation, have limitations, especially in complex networks.
- Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) have been used for link prediction, but they may not fully capture logical relationships between neighbors.
- The CNCIE approach defines logical predicates for neighbor relationships and uses multi-layer perceptrons to encode each logical set, allowing it to systematically model logical contexts.
- The method incorporates information entropy to quantify uncertainty in predictions, which helps to emphasize nodes where uncertainty is highest and improves prediction confidence.
- The authors tested CNCIE against benchmarks and performed ablation tests to validate its efficacy.
- The approach has potential applications beyond social networks, including protein interactions, e-commerce, fraud detection, and academic research.

### Important Links
- **Watch or Listen to the Episode**: https://journalclub.io/episodes/common-neighbor-completion-with-information-entropy-for-link-prediction-in-social-networks?token=20nuBcFudhaOF4KisnWjwjriaW1aW5kRd7JKaeTotPintHqY7j (access to the full video or audio discussion of the topic)
- **Read the Original Paper**: https://journalclub.io/track/6pokSatRKQTiCY0O54V9O8Gntc8IW7BOfBx7csqoHtLBxn1YDO (access to the full research paper)
- **Privacy**: https://journalclub.io/track/pwB4GcSh5xIxLQB5KbTtRZ9KQxezrWfaRwfdj8HveRFW6nXwbb (information on JournalClub.io's privacy policy)
- **Preferences**: https://journalclub.io/track/uyqsFHe0fPFzxkLLdir95t5hRxbeb9PggNNT3hpi9QNxNXVaRZ (options for managing newsletter preferences)
- **Unsubscribe**: https://journalclub.io/unsubscribe/?uid=z0Litxqnnl9rqdjV78XM9yL6l (option!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!to stop receiving the newsletter)

Common Neighbor Completion with Information Entropy for Link Prediction in Social Networks   

Your job is to build a feature that suggests ‚Äúpeople you may know‚Äù. When a user is browsing around they should see a little box somewhere on the site that lists the users we ‚Äúthink‚Äù they might actually already know, but haven‚Äôt yet connected with.

![](https://journalclub.io/px/wmPhv5qDLoQL63VM4asLCZKx9MjPdotDX6B6SWccJgedhws0Ur)

Common Neighbor Completion with Information Entropy for Link Prediction in Social Networks

JournalClub.io, November 30th 2025  
  

[![Thumbnail of today's episode.](https://cdn.filestackcontent.com/Rl6yReNQqmLZXxSMjxRA)](https://journalclub.io/episodes/common-neighbor-completion-with-information-entropy-for-link-prediction-in-social-networks?token=20nuBcFudhaOF4KisnWjwjriaW1aW5kRd7JKaeTotPintHqY7j)
